subject: RE: [junit] correct order of tests
msgSnippet: Servus, This is why when people learn JUnit, they should learn how to put a test suite together by hand first, and realize that the test runner is actually
messageBody:
Servus,

This is why when people learn JUnit, they should learn how to
put a
test suite together "by hand" first, and realize that the test
runner
is actually just automating some of what would otherwise be
their work.
It's a little thing, but important.

I'm not sure, if this is everytime the best way.

If use a tool, most of the time I'm not intersted in the details of that
tool. I use it as a blackbox and I'm happy if it works how I expect it.
After some time of experience and if I have to use this tool very
intensive, it could be, that I'm going to dive deeper into the inwards.

Actually I'm at that point right now. I'm writing a
TestPlanGenerator-tool, that creates TestCases and TestSuites from the
XMI-Export of an UML-modeling-tool, and now I have to have a closer look
at the JUnit-framework ......

Wolfgang
